description: Applications of physical chemistry to chemical engineering systems. Equilibrium statistical mechanics of ideal gases, dense fluids and interfacial phases. Chemical reaction rates. Collision and transition state theories. Heterogeneous catalysis. Electronic structure and properties of solids.
name: ADV CHEM ENG SCIENCE

values.comments:
This course covers applications of physical chemistry to chemical engineering systems, equilibrium statistical mechanics of ideal gases, dense fluids and interfacial phases, chemical reaction rates, collision and transition state theories, heterogeneous catalysis, electronic structure, and properties of solids.

Of the two reviews submitted for this course, the students found the class to be “stressful” and “at times confusing,” but believed that they learned a lot despite the class being hard. 

The professor was reported as being “very knowledgeable, clear, and concise in his lectures” and “somehow able to keep most of his students awake for a 1.5 hour class at 9:00 in the morning.”

Students believed that the material assigned was difficult and extremely time consuming, and noted that “material needed to complete the problem sets would not be covered until several days before they were due.” One student found that the equations the professor gave didn’t match up with the equations in the book, which made him spend countless hours rederiving the problems to make sure that the problem set was answered correctly. Students generally found the exams to be fair.

This review is based on the 4 student comments that were submitted.
